The Muslim Brotherhood argues that the series depicts them as a violent, fundamentalist group, whose leaders are deceptive businessmen merely hungry for authority<ref name="Brotherhood founder's son files lawsuit against TV series writer, producers" />. The Muslim Brotherhood quickly decided to retaliate by producing its own series portraying the movementâs history. "''Hassan Al-Banna: '''The Journey Did Not End'''''" is a 32-episode series to be filmed immediately after [[Ramadan]]<ref name="Ramadan series rock the boat" />.
The Muslim Brotherhood argues that the series depicts them as a violent, fundamentalist group, whose leaders are deceptive businessmen merely hungry for authority<ref name="Brotherhood founder's son files lawsuit against TV series writer, producers" />. The Muslim Brotherhood quickly decided to retaliate by producing its own series portraying the movementâs history. "''Hassan Al-Banna: '''The Journey Did Not End'''''" is a 32-episode series to be filmed immediately after [[Ramadan]]<ref name="Ramadan series rock the boat" />.
â
More general accusations accuse the government of [[Hosni Mubarak]] of influencing the series to present the Brotherhood in a thoroughly negative light (and conversely to present the Egyptian regime, particularly the [[State Security Intelligence Service|State Security apparatus]], in a thoroughly positive light) ahead of the [[Egyptian parliamentary elections, 2010|Egyptian parliamentary elections of 28 November 2010]], in which the Brotherhood forms the larges opposition bloc to the ruling [[National Democratic Party (Egypt)|National Democratic Party]]. <ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/tv-show-muslim-brotherhood-stirs-outrage |title= TV show on Muslim Brotherhood stirs outrage|author=Noha El-Hennawy |date=17 August 2010 |work= |publisher=[[Al-Masry Al-Yaum]] |accessdate=23 October 2010}}</ref>
+
More general accusations accuse the government of [[Hosni Mubarak]] of influencing the series to present the Brotherhood in a thoroughly negative light (and conversely to present the Egyptian regime, particularly the [[State Security Intelligence Service|State Security apparatus]], in a thoroughly positive light) ahead of the [[Egyptian parliamentary election, 2010|Egyptian parliamentary elections of 28 November 2010]], in which the Brotherhood forms the larges opposition bloc to the ruling [[National Democratic Party (Egypt)|National Democratic Party]]. <ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/tv-show-muslim-brotherhood-stirs-outrage |title= TV show on Muslim Brotherhood stirs outrage|author=Noha El-Hennawy |date=17 August 2010 |work= |publisher=[[Al-Masry Al-Yaum]] |accessdate=23 October 2010}}</ref>
